etymologies: early 20th century: from French cubisme, from cube (see cube)

definitions: an early 20th-century style and movement in art, especially painting, in which perspective with a single viewpoint was abandoned and use was made of simple geometric shapes, interlocking planes, and, later, collage.

notes.text: Cubism was a reaction against traditional modes of representation and impressionist concerns with light and color. The style, created by Picasso and Braque and first named by the French critic Louis Vauxcelles in 1908, was inspired by the later work of Cézanne and by African sculpture

shortDefinitions: early 20th-century style and movement in art in which perspective with single viewpoint was abandoned and use was made of simple geometric shapes
